alert.note: Alert for Mercer; Summers (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 19 at 8:06PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Summers and east central Mercer Counties through 830 PM EDT... At 806 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Lerona, or near Camp Creek, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lerona... Indian Mills... and Lick Creek. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. If on or near Bluestone Lake, get out of the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. Remember, lightning can strike out to 10 miles from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm.
